Description.1: You are a religious devotee. Acolytes tend to live somewhat sheltered lives as priests and aides in major religions, until the call to adventure sounds. Acolytes serving in the Church of the Holy Light are most common, but there are also other faiths with established hierarchies, such as the Troll faith in the Loa.

Suggestions.Description: Acolytes are shaped by their experience in temples or other religious communities. Their study of the history and tenets of their faith and their relationships to temples, shrines, or hierarchies affect their mannerisms and ideals. Their flaws might be some hidden hypocrisy or heretical idea, or an ideal or bond taken to an extreme.

Personality.1: I idolize a particular hero of my faith, and constantly refer to that person's deeds and example.
Personality.2: I can find common ground between the fiercest enemies, empathizing with them and always working toward peace.
Personality.3: I see omens in every event and action. The gods try to speak to us, we just need to listen.
Personality.4: Nothing can shake my optimistic attitude.
Personality.5: I quote (or misquote) sacred texts and proverbs in almost every situation.
Personality.6: I am tolerant (or intolerant) of other faiths and respect (or condemn) the worship of other gods.
Personality.7: I've enjoyed fine food, drink, and high society among my temple's elite. Rough living grates on me.
Personality.8: I've spent so long in the temple that I have little practical experience dealing with people in the outside world.

1.Title: Tradition
1.Value: The ancient traditions of worship and sacrifice must be preserved and upheld. (Lawful)

2.Title: Charity
2.Value: I always try to help those in need, no matter what the personal cost. (Good)

3.Title: Change
3.Value: We must help bring about the changes the gods are constantly working in the world. (Chaotic)

4.Title: Power
4.Value: I hope to one day rise to the top of my faith's religious hierarchy. (Lawful)

5.Title: Faith
5.Value: I trust that my deity will guide my actions. I have faith that if I work hard, things will go well. (Lawful)

6.Title: Aspiration
6.Value: I seek to prove myself worthy of my god's favor by matching my actions against their teachings. (Any)

Bonds.1: I would die to recover an ancient relic of my faith that was lost long ago.
Bonds.2: I will someday get revenge on the corrupt temple hierarchy who branded me a heretic.
Bonds.3: I owe my life to the priest who took me in when my parents died.
Bonds.4: Everything I do is for the common people.
Bonds.5: I will do anything to protect the temple where I served.
Bonds.6: I seek to preserve a sacred text that my enemies consider heretical and seek to destroy.

Flaws.1: I judge others harshly, and myself even more severely.
Flaws.2: I put too much trust in those who wield power within my temple's hierarchy.
Flaws.3: My piety sometimes leads me to blindly trust those that profess faith in my god.
Flaws.4: I am inflexible in my thinking.
Flaws.5: I am suspicious of strangers and expect the worst of them.
Flaws.6: Once I pick a goal, I become obsessed with it to the detriment of everything else in my life.

1.Value: You have dedicated your life (and very soul) to the service of a cult. This could be anything from a benign splinter organization away from the main church of the Holy Light to the dark Cult of the Damned, various demon cults (such as with many orcish clans), the Cult of Shadow, among others. With this variant, you are trained in hiding your faith and loyalties from others. You may also be part of the Shadow Council, venerating the Old Gods.

2.Value: Rather than training in Insight and Religion, you may exchange one of the proficiencies with Deception or Intimidation.

1.Value: You are part of the Sisterhood of Elune, a matriarchal religious/military organization that holds great sway in Night Elven society. The sisterhood is the gateway of a night elven sister joining the priesthood of Elune (becoming a Priestess of the Moon), or a member of the Watchers organization. Elite Watchers are elevated to being Wardens, legendary jailors of the enemies of Night Elven society.

2.Value: Rather than training in Insight and Religion, you may exchange one of the proficiencies with Stealth. Also, rather than having 5 sticks of incense, you instead have an insignia of rank in the priesthood, and a bow of your choice that was the tool of your training in the favored weapon of the moon goddess.

Description.1: You are a special sort of criminal who specializes in taking advantage of others. Charlatans tend to live in urbanized areas where they have many marks (targets) and areas where they can retreat if discovered.
Description.2: Anyone can become a charlatan, but they are common among human cities due to their urban nature.

Suggestions.Description: Charlatans are colorful characters who conceal their true selves behind the masks they construct. They reflect what people want to see, what they want to believe, and how they see the world. But their true selves are sometimes plagued by an uneasy conscience, an old enemy, or deep-seated trust issues.

Personality.1: I fall in and out of love easily, and am always pursuing someone.
Personality.2: I have a joke for every occasion, especially occasions where humor is inappropriate.
Personality.3: Flattery is my preferred trick for getting what I want.
Personality.4: I'm a born gambler who can't resist taking a risk for a potential payoff.
Personality.5: I lie about almost everything, even when there's no good reason to.
Personality.6: Sarcasm and insults are my weapons of choice.
Personality.7: I keep multiple holy symbols on me and invoke whatever deity might come in useful at any given moment.
Personality.8: I pocket anything I see that might have some value.

1.Title: Independence
1.Value: I am a free spirit – no one tells me what to do. (Chaotic)

2.Title: Fairness
2.Value: I never target people who can't afford to lose a few coins. (Lawful)

3.Title: Charity
3.Value: I distribute the money I acquire to the people who really need it. (Good)

4.Title: Creativity
4.Value: I never run the same con twice. (Chaotic)

5.Title: Friendship
5.Value: Material goods come and go. Bonds of friendship last forever. (Good)

6.Title: Aspiration
6.Value: I'm determined to make something of myself. (Any)

Bonds.1: I fleeced the wrong person and must work to ensure that this individual never crosses paths with me or those I care about.
Bonds.2: I owe everything to my mentor – a horrible person who's probably rotting in jail somewhere.
Bonds.3: Somewhere out there, I have a child who doesn't know me. I'm making the world better for him or her.
Bonds.4: I come from a noble family, and one day I'll reclaim my lands and title from those who stole them from me.
Bonds.5: A powerful person killed someone I love. Some day soon, I'll have my revenge.
Bonds.6: I swindled and ruined a person who didn't deserve it. I seek to atone for my misdeeds but might never be able to forgive myself.

Flaws.1: I can't resist a pretty face.
Flaws.2: I'm always in debt. I spend my ill-gotten gains on decadent luxuries faster than I bring them in.
Flaws.3: I'm convinced that no one could ever fool me the way I fool others.
Flaws.4: I'm too greedy for my own good. I can't resist taking a risk if there's money involved.
Flaws.5: I can't resist swindling people who are more powerful than me.
Flaws.6: I hate to admit it and will hate myself for it, but I'll run and preserve my own hide if the going gets tough.

Description.1: You are a criminal - who breaks the law for fun and profit. Criminals come from every walk of life and every type of environment, and they range from petty thievery to outright murder and assassinations.

Suggestions.Description: Criminals might seem like villains on the surface, and many of them are villainous to the core. But some have an abundance of endearing, if not redeeming, characteristics. There might be honor among thieves, but criminals rarely show any respect for law or authority.

Personality.1: I always have a plan for what to do when things go wrong.
Personality.2: I am always calm, no matter what the situation. I never raise my voice or let my emotions control me.
Personality.3: The first thing I do in a new place is note the locations of everything valuable – or where such things could be hidden.
Personality.4: I would rather make a new friend than a new enemy.
Personality.5: I am incredibly slow to trust. Those who seem the fairest often have the most to hide.
Personality.6: I don't pay attention to the risks in a situation. Never tell me the odds.
Personality.7: The best way to get me to do something is to tell me I can't do it.
Personality.8: I blow up at the slightest insult.

1.Title: Honor
1.Value: I don't steal from others in the trade. (Lawful)

2.Title: Freedom
2.Value: Chains are meant to be broken, as are those who would forge them. (Chaotic)

3.Title: Charity
3.Value: I steal from the wealthy so that I can help people in need. (Good)

4.Title: Greed
4.Value: I will do whatever it takes to become wealthy. (Evil)

5.Title: People
5.Value: I'm loyal to my friends, not to any ideals, and everyone else can take a trip down the Styx for all I care. (Neutral)

6.Title: Redemption
6.Value: There's a spark of good in everyone. (Good)

Bonds.1: I'm trying to pay off an old debt I owe to a generous benefactor.
Bonds.2: My ill-gotten gains go to support my family.
Bonds.3: Something important was taken from me, and I aim to steal it back.
Bonds.4: I will become the greatest thief that ever lived.
Bonds.5: I'm guilty of a terrible crime. I hope I can redeem myself for it.
Bonds.6: Someone I loved died because of I mistake I made. That will never happen again.

Flaws.1: When I see something valuable, I can't think about anything but how to steal it.
Flaws.2: When faced with a choice between money and my friends, I usually choose the money.
Flaws.3: If there's a plan, I'll forget it. If I don't forget it, I'll ignore it.
Flaws.4: I have a "tell" that reveals when I'm lying.
Flaws.5: I turn tail and run when things look bad.
Flaws.6: An innocent person is in prison for a crime that I committed. I'm okay with that.

1.Value: You are part of a state or organization‘s intelligence force. Operatives may belong to the Stormwind‘s SI:7, the Defias Brotherhood‘s operation cells, Ravenholdt, the Shadow Council‘s eyes and ears, or the Alterac Syndicate.

2.Value: Operatives act in the shadows or in brief flashes of activity to complete a critical mission, before retreating to safe houses and deliver their quarry, whether it be information or proof of a kill.

1.Value: You are part of the Forsaken Order of Deathstalkers, an elite guard that also doubles as a guild of assassins that serve the Banshee Queen and her advisors. Deathstalkers are skilled assassins who utilize their undead nature in conducting infiltrations and assassinations.

2.Title: Deathstalker Test
2.Value: Becoming a Deathstalker is a deadly mission in of itself. The test given to prospective Deathstalkers usually tests their patience, cunning, or strength, and are tailored to reveal the limits applicant‘s strengths and how far they will go for the Banshee Queen and the Forsaken.

Options.1: Assassinate an enemy (scarlet crusader, alliance spy, or a scourge necromancer)
Options.2: Track and apprehend infiltrators to Forsaken society or leadership
Options.3: Deliver a critical message through hostile territory
Options.4: Retrieve the head of a fallen Deathstalker agent
Options.5: Infiltrate, sabotage, or conduct reconnaissance on an enemy of the Forsaken
Options.6: Guard an ally of the Forsaken against assassination without them realizing it

4.Value: You may start with a dagger that doubles as a signet of rank (called the Shadowstalker), and one memento of your Deathstalker test.

1.Value: The Uncrowned is a secret society who claim to be "the slayers of kings, the downfall of empires, and the unseen blades that write the true history of this world." Besides their role as a secret society, the Uncrowned also guard the world against the threats that seek to destroy it to preserve their interests.

2.Value: As part of the Uncrowned, you appear as a member of any other faction in Azeroth, such as a member of Ravenholdt, SI:7, or one of the many pirate organizations (such as Bloodsail Buccaneers).

Description.1: You are an actor, singer, dancer or other who provides enjoyment through their performances to others. Every culture enjoys the entertainer‘s work.

Suggestions.Description: Successful entertainers have to be able to capture and hold an audience's attention, so they tend to have flamboyant or forceful personalities. They're inclined toward the romantic and often cling to high-minded ideals about the practice of art and the appreciation of beauty.

Personality.1: I know a story relevant to almost every situation.
Personality.2: Whenever I come to a new place, I collect local rumors and spread gossip.
Personality.3: I'm a hopeless romantic, always searching for that "special someone."
Personality.4: Nobody stays angry at me or around me for long, since I can defuse any amount of tension.
Personality.5: I love a good insult, even one directed at me.
Personality.6: I get bitter if I'm not the center of attention.
Personality.7: I'll settle for nothing less than perfection.
Personality.8: I change my mood or my mind as quickly as I change key in a song.

1.Title: Beauty
1.Value: When I perform, I make the world better than it was. (Good)

2.Title: Tradition
2.Value: The stories, legends, and songs of the past must never be forgotten, for they teach us who we are. (Lawful)

3.Title: Creativity
3.Value: The world is in need of new ideas and bold action. (Chaotic)

4.Title: Greed
4.Value: I'm only in it for the money and fame. (Evil)

5.Title: People
5.Value: I like seeing the smiles on people's faces when I perform. That's all that matters. (Neutral)

6.Title: Honesty
6.Value: Art should reflect the soul; it should come from within and reveal who we really are. (Any)

Bonds.1: My instrument is my most treasured possession, and it reminds me of someone I love.
Bonds.2: Someone stole my precious instrument, and someday I'll get it back.
Bonds.3: I want to be famous, whatever it takes.
Bonds.4: I idolize a hero of the old tales and measure my deeds against that person's.
Bonds.5: I will do anything to prove myself superior to my hated rival.
Bonds.6: I would do anything for the other members of my old troupe.

Flaws.1: I'll do anything to win fame and renown.
Flaws.2: I'm a sucker for a pretty face.
Flaws.3: A scandal prevents me from ever going home again. That kind of trouble seems to follow me around.
Flaws.4: I once satirized a noble who still wants my head. It was a mistake that I will likely repeat.
Flaws.5: I have trouble keeping my true feelings hidden. My sharp tongue lands me in trouble.
Flaws.6: Despite my best efforts, I am unreliable to my friends.

1.Value: A gladiator is as much an entertainer as any minstrel or circus performer trained to make the arts of combat into a spectacle the crowd can enjoy. This kind of flashy combat is your entertainer routine, though you might also have some skills as a tumbler or actor. Using your By Popular Demand feature, you can find a place to perform in any place that features combat for entertainment-perhaps a gladiatorial arena or secret pit fighting club.

2.Value: You can replace the musical instrument in your equipment package with an inexpensive but unusual weapon, such as a trident or net.

1.Value: The Darkmoon Faire showcases the weird and extraordinary once a month. Gathering the exotic from around the world, Silas Darkmoon presents the Darkmoon Faire as a celebration of the wonders and mysteries found in Azeroth. The faire spends most of its time in parts unknown but is available from time to time by accessing portals in Elwynn Forest and Mulgore, which are teleportation circles conjured by forces (apparently) unknown to Darkmoon Isle.It often takes three days to set up the new attractions (from exotic vendors selling alien mounts and magic item shops, to being launched from the Darkmoon Cannon to win tokens), and remains active for one week—afterwards, the portals close, and the faire goes on the move once more.

Description.1: Before stepping onto the world stage, you first saved a lone village near to your heart. A Folk Hero may rise from anywhere he or she is needed; wherever a monster pillages or a child cries out, they‘ll be there.
Description.2: Folk heroes arise from exceptional circumstances. Many heroes of Azeroth started as folk heroes, questing to resolve family feuds in Elwynn to bringing closure to widowed orcs of the Barrens.

Suggestions.Description: A folk hero is one of the common people, for better or for worse. Most folk heroes look on their humble origins as a virtue, not a shortcoming, and their home communities remain very important to them.

Personality.1: I judge people by their actions, not their words.
Personality.2: If someone is in trouble, I'm always ready to lend help.
Personality.3: When I set my mind to something, I follow through no matter what gets in my way.
Personality.4: I have a strong sense of fair play and always try to find the most equitable solution to arguments.
Personality.5: I'm confident in my own abilities and do what I can to instill confidence in others.
Personality.6: Thinking is for other people. I prefer action.
Personality.7: I misuse long words in an attempt to sound smarter.
Personality.8: I get bored easily. When am I going to get on with my destiny?

1.Title: Respect
1.Value: People deserve to be treated with dignity and respect. (Good)

2.Title: Fairness
2.Value: No one should get preferential treatment before the law, and no one is above the law. (Lawful)

3.Title: Freedom
3.Value: Tyrants must not be allowed to oppress the people. (Chaotic)

4.Title: Might
4.Value: If I become strong, I can take what I want – what I deserve. (Evil)

5.Title: Sincerity
5.Value: There's no good in pretending to be something I'm not. (Neutral)

6.Title: Destiny
6.Value: Nothing and no one can steer me away from my higher calling. (Any)

Bonds.1: I have a family, but I have no idea where they are. One day, I hope to see them again.
Bonds.2: I worked the land, I love the land, and I will protect the land.
Bonds.3: A proud noble once gave me a horrible beating, and I will take my revenge on any bully I encounter.
Bonds.4: My tools are symbols of my past life, and I carry them so that I will never forget my roots.
Bonds.5: I protect those who cannot protect themselves.
Bonds.6: I wish my childhood sweetheart had come with me to pursue my destiny.

Flaws.1: The tyrant who rules my land will stop at nothing to see me killed.
Flaws.2: I'm convinced of the significance of my destiny, and blind to my shortcomings and the risk of failure.
Flaws.3: The people who knew me when I was young know my shameful secret, so I can never go home again.
Flaws.4: I have a weakness for the vices of the city, especially hard drink.
Flaws.5: Secretly, I believe that things would be better if I were a tyrant lording over the land.
Flaws.6: I have trouble trusting in my allies.

1.Value: A gladiator is as much an entertainer as any minstrel or circus performer trained to make the arts of combat into a spectacle the crowd can enjoy. This kind of flashy combat is your entertainer routine, though you might also have some skills as a tumbler or actor. Using your By Popular Demand feature, you can find a place to perform in any place that features combat for entertainment-perhaps a gladiatorial arena or secret pit fighting club.

2.Value: You can replace the musical instrument in your equipment package with an inexpensive but unusual weapon, such as a trident or net.

Description.1: You are a person of business. Artisans learned a trade and practice it well, usually accompanied by a union of like-minded individuals.
Description.2: Most artisans are found in large urban settlements, offering training or apprenticeship in the knowledge of how to create rare materials. Many guilds exist in Azeroth, such as the Alliance‘s MEGA (Mechanical Engineering Guild, Associated), and the Great Anvil Smiths of Ironforge, or the independent (Goblin Experimental Engineering Korporation).

Suggestions.Description: Guild artisans are among the most ordinary people in the world until they set down their tools and take up an adventuring career. They understand the value of hard work and the importance of community, but they're vulnerable to sins of greed and covetousness.

Personality.1: I believe that anything worth doing is worth doing right. I can't help it – I'm a perfectionist.
Personality.2: I'm a snob who looks down on those who can't appreciate fine art.
Personality.3: I always want to know how things work and what makes people tick.
Personality.4: I'm full of witty aphorisms and have a proverb for every occasion.
Personality.5: I'm rude to people who lack my commitment to hard work and fair play.
Personality.6: I like to talk at length about my profession.
Personality.7: I don't part with my money easily and will haggle tirelessly to get the best deal possible.
Personality.8: I'm well known for my work, and I want to make sure everyone appreciates it. I'm always taken aback when people haven't heard of me.

1.Title: Community
1.Value: It is the duty of all civilized people to strengthen the bonds of community and the security of civilization. (Lawful)

2.Title: Generosity
2.Value: My talents were given to me so that I could use them to benefit the world. (Good)

3.Title: Freedom
3.Value: Everyone should be free to pursue his or her own livelihood. (Chaotic)

4.Title: Greed
4.Value: I'm only in it for the money. (Evil)

5.Title: People
5.Value: I'm committed to the people I care about, not to ideals. (Neutral)

6.Title: Aspiration
6.Value: I work hard to be the best there is at my craft. (Any)

Bonds.1: The workshop where I learned my trade is the most important place in the world to me.
Bonds.2: I created a great work for someone, and then found them unworthy to receive it. I'm still looking for someone worthy.
Bonds.3: I owe my guild a great debt for forging me into the person I am today.
Bonds.4: I pursue wealth to secure someone's love.
Bonds.5: One day I will return to my guild and prove that I am the greatest artisan of them all.
Bonds.6: I will get revenge on the evil forces that destroyed my place of business and ruined my livelihood.

Flaws.1: I'll do anything to get my hands on something rare or priceless.
Flaws.2: I'm quick to assume that someone is trying to cheat me.
Flaws.3: No one must ever learn that I once stole money from guild coffers.
Flaws.4: I'm never satisfied with what I have – I always want more.
Flaws.5: I would kill to acquire a noble title.
Flaws.6: I'm horribly jealous of anyone who can outshine my handiwork. Everywhere I go, I'm surrounded by rivals.

1.Value: Instead of an artisans' guild, you might belong to a guild of traders, caravan masters, or shopkeepers. You don't craft items yourself but earn a living by buying and selling the works of others (or the raw materials artisans need to practice their craft). Your guild might be a large merchant consortium (or family) with interests across the region. Perhaps you transported goods from one place to another, by ship, wagon, or caravan, or bought them from traveling traders and sold them in your own little shop. In some ways, the traveling merchant's life lends itself to adventure far more than the life of an artisan.

2.Value: Rather than proficiency with artisan's tools, you might be proficient with navigator's tools or an additional language. And instead of artisan's tools, you can start with a mule and a cart.

1.Value: You may have chosen to start your own enterprise over joining the employ of a guild or company. This requires great initiative and persistence, as other companies may wish to force a merger to take advantage of your innovations or to get rid of a competitor.

Gnome and forsaken alchemists and gnomish and dwarven tinkers often boast membership in a guild that could support their crafting endeavors, from providing training in rare material recipes to financial aid when a project becomes too expensive (in return for a percent on future income, of course!).

2.Value: Furthermore, your guild may possess engineering blueprints, alchemy formulae, or even infusion matrices they might share with you, in return for services rendered or for reduced cost in comparison to other sources.

1.Value: The Thorium Brotherhood (TB Ltd.) is a group of Dark Iron dwarves who are not members of the Dark Iron clan. On the cliffs overlooking the region called the Cauldron, in the far north of the Searing Gorge, the dwarves of the Thorium Brotherhood have established a base of operations, Thorium Point. From here, they keep a close eye on the Dark Iron dwarves' activities in the Searing Gorge and beyond.

2.Value: The Thorium Brotherhood comprises many exceptionally talented craftsmen, and the blacksmiths of the Brotherhood are rumored to be among the finest Azeroth has ever seen. They possess the knowledge required to make the arms and armaments of Ragnaros, the Fire Lord, but lack the manpower to obtain the materials required for the crafting.

3.Value: A daunting task, no doubt, but gaining access to the Thorium Brotherhood's secrets should prove to be a reward well worth the effort.

1.Value: A cartel refers to a large group of goblin traders. Goblin cartels often compete with other cartels, such as in the Trade Wars. These organizations are normally led by trade princes, but they don't have to be; for example, although the Venture Company is a cartel, its leader Mogul Razdunk is not a trade prince.

2.Value: After the goblins overthrew the Zandalaritrolls, they celebrated their new found freedom by turning on each other, creating chaos as countless feuds were waged and alliances formed. Soon enough they were split into various different groups, with the most powerful of these known as the cartels. However, as the battles raged on and it became clear no one was actually winning, the cartels realized it was in their mutual interests to broker a truce. Despite this, the conflict would never really end, as the goblins now turned to trade, doing battle in the economic arena. For years to come the cartels were rivals, constantly outshining and outsmarting each other as they continued in their quest for wealth and power.

3.Value: As a cartel member, you do not create but trade, and earn a living by maximizing profit by selling to the neediest individuals or organizations. You may use honorable means, but there is no love lost between goblins and the other races of Azeroth—establishing monopolies, sabotaging the competition, and selling basic living expenses are cutthroat prices to starving buyers made trade princes trade princes, after all!

4.Value: Rather than proficiency with artisan‘s tools, you might be proficient with navigator‘s tools, a vehicle, or an additional language. And instead of artisan‘s tools, you can start with a mule and a cart, or a permanent free pass on goblin balloons for yourself and your adventuring companions.

Description.1: You have faced terrible darkness, and it has left its mark on you. Haunted ones are born from terrible circumstances, such as beingsubject to demonic possession or the influence of the Old Gods.

Suggestions.Description: You have learned to live with the terror that haunts you. You are a survivor, who can be very protective of those who bring light into your darkened life.

Personality.1: I don't run from evil. Evil runs from me.
Personality.2: I like to read and memorize poetry. It keeps me calm and brings me fleeting moments of happiness.
Personality.3: I spend money freely and live life to the fullest, knowing that tomorrow I might die.
Personality.4: I live for the thrill of the hunt.
Personality.5: I don’t talk about the thing that torments me. I’d rather not burden others with my curse.
Personality.6: I expect danger around every corner.
Personality.7: I refuse to become a victim, and I will not allow others to be victimized.
Personality.8: I put no trust in divine beings.

1.Title: Selflessness
1.Value: I try to help those in need, no matter what the personal cost. (Good)

2.Title: Determination
2.Value: I’ll stop the spirits that haunt me or die trying. (Any)

3.Title: Greater Good
3.Value: I kill monsters to make the world a safer place, and to exorcise my own demons. (Good)

4.Title: Freedom
4.Value: I have a dark calling that puts me above the law. (Chaotic)

5.Title: Logic
5.Value: I like to know my enemy’s capabilities and weaknesses before rushing into battle. (Lawful)

6.Title: Destruction
6.Value: I’m a monster that destroys other monsters, and anything else that gets in my way. (Evil)

Bonds.1: I keep my thoughts and discoveries in a journal. My journal is my legacy.
Bonds.2: I would sacrifice my life and my soul to protect the innocent.
Bonds.3: My torment drove away the person I love. I strive to win back the love I’ve lost.
Bonds.4: A terrible guilt consumes me. I hope that I can find redemption through my actions.
Bonds.5: There’s evil in me, I can feel it. It must never be set free.
Bonds.6: I have a child to protect. I must make the world a safer place for them.

Flaws.1: I have certain rituals that I must follow every day. I can never break them.
Flaws.2: I assume the worst in people.
Flaws.3: I feel no compassion for the dead. They’re the lucky ones.
Flaws.5: I am a purveyor of doom and gloom who lives in a world without hope.
Flaws.6: I talk to spirits that no one else can see.

1.Value: You are of the Illidari—the faction of Illidan Stormrage, and you represent his will as part of a force made of demon hunters and warlocks. The Illidari also include demonic forces that chose to serve him over the Legion.

2.Value: The most elite of Illidan's armies are his demon hunter servitors, night elves and blood elves trained to be the Betrayer's mightiest enforcers, the bane of demonkind. Zealously loyal to their master, the Illidari demon hunters have a strong identity and a close bond, although their heavy fel corruption and demonic techniques have inspired dread in their fellow elves.

3.Value: You may replace your language with Eredun (corrupted). You also start with a demon hunter‘s pack instead of a monster hunter‘s pack. The demon hunter's pack includes a chest, a crowbar, a hammer, a holy symbol (such of Elune or the Holy Light), a flask of holy water, a set of manacles, a silver mirror, a flask of oil, a tinderbox, and three torches. Purchasing the pack costs 33 gp, which is cheaper than buying its contents individually.

Description.1: You are a person who lives in isolation. Hermits prefer the peace and quiet of solitude to the bustle of towns and villages. For whatever reason they have reentered society once more.

Suggestions.Description: Some hermits are well suited to a life of seclusion, whereas others chafe against it and long for company. Whether they embrace solitude or long to escape it, the solitary life shapes their attitudes and ideals. A few are driven slightly mad by their years apart from society.

Personality.1: I've been isolated for so long that I rarely speak, preferring gestures and the occasional grunt.
Personality.2: I am utterly serene, even in the face of disaster.
Personality.3: The leader of my community had something wise to say on every topic, and I am eager to share that wisdom.
Personality.4: I feel tremendous empathy for all who suffer.
Personality.5: I'm oblivious to etiquette and social expectations.
Personality.6: I connect everything that happens to me to a grand, cosmic plan.
Personality.7: I often get lost in my own thoughts and contemplation, becoming oblivious to my surroundings.
Personality.8: I am working on a grand philosophical theory and love sharing my ideas.

1.Title: Greater Good
1.Value: My gifts are meant to be shared with all, not used for my own benefit. (Good)

2.Title: Logic
2.Value: Emotions must not cloud our sense of what is right and true, or our logical thinking. (Lawful)

3.Title: Free Thinking
3.Value: Inquiry and curiosity are the pillars of progress. (Chaotic)

4.Title: Power
4.Value: Solitude and contemplation are paths toward mystical or magical power. (Evil)

5.Title: Live and Let Live
5.Value: Meddling in the affairs of others only causes trouble. (Neutral)

6.Title: Self-Knowledge
6.Value: If you know yourself, there's nothing left to know. (Any)

Bonds.1: Nothing is more important than the other members of my hermitage, order, or association.
Bonds.2: I entered seclusion to hide from the ones who might still be hunting me. I must someday confront them.
Bonds.3: I'm still seeking the enlightenment I pursued in my seclusion, and it still eludes me.
Bonds.4: I entered seclusion because I loved someone I could not have.
Bonds.5: Should my discovery come to light, it could bring ruin to the world.
Bonds.6: My isolation gave me great insight into a great evil that only I can destroy.

Flaws.1: Now that I've returned to the world, I enjoy its delights a little too much.
Flaws.2: I harbor dark, bloodthirsty thoughts that my isolation and meditation failed to quell.
Flaws.3: I am dogmatic in my thoughts and philosophy.
Flaws.4: I let my need to win arguments overshadow friendships and harmony.
Flaws.5: I'd risk too much to uncover a lost bit of knowledge.
Flaws.6: I like keeping secrets and won't share them with anyone.

1.Value: Druids of Azeroth are more attuned to the world‘s dream-realm, the Emerald Dream, than any other creature. The great Malfurion Stormrage was in this slumber ever since the War of the Ancients, nearly 10,000 years before Orcs emerged on Azeroth, as well as his fellow druids of many circles, such as the Druids of the Talon, Druids of the Claw, and Druids of the Antler.

2.Value: Today, the Cenarion Circle consists of many such hermit druids from many races, from Night Elves to Tauren to Worgen, even to the odd promising human or high elf apprentice. The Cenarion Circle often gathers at seasonal periods (such as solstices and seasonal holy days) to discuss the issues the world faces, from the spread of the mysterious Emerald Nightmare to portents and omens they notice during the Emerald Sleep.

Description.1: You are an aristocrat or important member of society. Nobles exist in all societies, even if they aren‘t legally defined as such. There is always a cultural, spiritual, or economic elitein every civilization, regardless of the title itself.
Description.2: You may be a noble of the Stormwind House of Nobles, dissatisfied with the role the Alliance has or your fellow nobles (egged on by nobles such as Lady Prestor), or a high tribesman in orcish society. While few night elven nobles have remaining grievances after they witnessed the folly of Queen Azshara during the War of the Ancients, some do long for the days where they ruled and the Sisterhood of Elune and the Druids were not calling the shots.
Description.3: Where the nobles of Alterac turned to serve or join the criminal Syndicate, high elven noble refugees have decided to fight back for their homelands.

Suggestions.Description: Nobles are born and raised to a very different lifestyle than most people ever experience, and their personalities reflect that upbringing. A noble title comes with a plethora of bonds –responsibilities to family, to other nobles (including the sovereign), to the people entrusted to the family's care, or even to the title itself. But this responsibility is often a good way to undermine a noble.

Personality.1: My eloquent flattery makes everyone I talk to feel like the most wonderful and important person in the world.
Personality.2: The common folk love me for my kindness and generosity.
Personality.3: No one could doubt by looking at my regal bearing that I am a cut above the unwashed masses.
Personality.4: I take great pains to always look my best and follow the latest fashions.
Personality.5: I don't like to get my hands dirty, and I won't be caught dead in unsuitable accommodations.
Personality.6: Despite my noble birth, I do not place myself above other folk. We all have the same blood.
Personality.7: My favor, once lost, is lost forever.
Personality.8: If you do me an injury, I will crush you, ruin your name, and salt your fields.

1.Title: Respect
1.Value: Respect is due to me because of my position, but all people regardless of station deserve to be treated with dignity. (Good)

2.Title: Responsibility
2.Value: It is my duty to respect the authority of those above me, just as those below me must respect mine. (Lawful)

3.Title: Independence
3.Value: I must prove that I can handle myself without the coddling of my family. (Chaotic)

4.Title: Power
4.Value: If I can attain more power, no one will tell me what to do. (Evil)

5.Title: Family
5.Value: Blood runs thicker than water. (Any)

6.Title: Noble Obligation
6.Value: It is my duty to protect and care for the people beneath me. (Good)

Bonds.1: I will face any challenge to win the approval of my family.
Bonds.2: My house's alliance with another noble family must be sustained at all costs.
Bonds.3: Nothing is more important than the other members of my family.
Bonds.4: I am in love with the heir of a family that my family despises.
Bonds.5: My loyalty to my sovereign is unwavering.
Bonds.6: The common folk must see me as a hero of the people.

Flaws.1: I secretly believe that everyone is beneath me.
Flaws.2: I hide a truly scandalous secret that could ruin my family forever.
Flaws.3: I too often hear veiled insults and threats in every word addressed to me, and I'm quick to anger.
Flaws.4: I have an insatiable desire for carnal pleasures.
Flaws.5: In fact, the world does revolve around me.
Flaws.6: By my words and actions, I often bring shame to my family.

1.Value: There are many knightly orders on Azeroth, from the noble Knights of Stormwind and the remnants of the Silver Hand, to the Argent Dawn or Scarlet Crusade orders. Orcish raiders also have a position of importance in the Horde and in their tribes, often serving as advisors and councilors as well as generals and commanders.
You are an elite member of your tribe. Many tribes of dozens of races spread among Azeroth, such as the various troll and orc clans.

2.Value: Instead of receiving a signet ring, you have a symbol or flag of your clan.

Description.1: You are a survivor of the wilderness. An outlander, like the hermit, tends to live alone though not exclusively. They live in the wilds for years at a time away from greater civilization. They live off the land and survive using their wits.
Description.2: Every race has its members who chose to live apart from urban civilization.

Suggestions.Description: Often considered rude and uncouth among civilized folk, outlanders have little respect for the niceties of life in the cities. The ties of tribe, clan, family, and the natural world of which they are a part are the most important bonds to most outlanders.

Personality.1: I'm driven by a wanderlust that led me away from home.
Personality.2: I watch over my friends as if they were a litter of newborn pups.
Personality.3: I once ran twenty-five miles without stopping to warn my clan of an approaching orc horde. I'd do it again if I had to.
Personality.4: I have a lesson for every situation, drawn from observing nature.
Personality.5: I place no stock in wealthy or well-mannered folk. Money and manners won't save you from a hungry owlbear.
Personality.6: I'm always picking things up, absently fiddling with them, and sometimes accidentally breaking them.
Personality.7: I feel far more comfortable around animals than people.
Personality.8: I was, in fact, raised by wolves.

1.Title: Change
1.Value: Life is like the seasons, in constant change, and we must change with it. (Chaotic)

2.Title: Greater Good
2.Value: It is each person's responsibility to make the most happiness for the whole tribe. (Good)

3.Title: Honor
3.Value: If I dishonor myself, I dishonor my whole clan. (Lawful)

4.Title: Might
4.Value: The strongest are meant to rule. (Evil)

5.Title: Nature
5.Value: The natural world is more important than all the constructs of civilization. (Neutral)

6.Title: Glory
6.Value: I must earn glory in battle, for myself and my clan. (Any)

Bonds.1: My family, clan, or tribe is the most important thing in my life, even when they are far from me.
Bonds.2: An injury to the unspoiled wilderness of my home is an injury to me.
Bonds.3: I will bring terrible wrath down on the evildoers who destroyed my homeland.
Bonds.4: I am the last of my tribe, and it is up to me to ensure their names enter legend.
Bonds.5: I suffer awful visions of a coming disaster and will do anything to prevent it.
Bonds.6: It is my duty to provide children to sustain my tribe.

Flaws.1: I am too enamored of ale, wine, and other intoxicants.
Flaws.2: There's no room for caution in a life lived to the fullest.
Flaws.3: I remember every insult I've received and nurse a silent resentment toward anyone who's ever wronged me.
Flaws.4: I am slow to trust members of other races, tribes, and societies.
Flaws.5: Violence is my answer to almost any challenge.
Flaws.6: Don't expect me to save those who can't save themselves. It is nature's way that the strong thrive and the weak perish.

1.Value: You are capable combatant and survivalist who serves himself or his tribe, walking the wilderness and putting down threats to your people while living far from them. This could be for noble or spiritual reasons.

2.Value: Instead of proficiency in a musical instrument, you may be proficient with one artisan tool of your choice or the herbalism kit. You can also replace your staff with an herbalism kit.

1.Value: Instead of proficiency in a musical instrument, you may be proficient with one artisan tool of your choice or the herbalism kit. You can also replace your staff with an herbalism kit.

2.Value: As a spirit walker, your fur is pearly-white, and your eyes reflect the life of a thousand souls.

3.Value: Their bodies are vessels, conduits from the realm of the dead to the world of the living. As a spirit walker, you are often looked upon with awe and fear by their brethren. A spirit walker strong enough to bear the weight of so many souls achieves a mystical transcendence, embodying the collective will and experience of the generations that are reaching out to him.

4.Value: Alternatively, instead of being a tauren, you might be an orc from the Shattered Hand clan.

Description.1: You are a scholar of mystic or mundane knowledge. Sages are a class of learners who delve into the deepest mysteries and the murkiest of Apocrypha to bring truth to the people, or a sizeable grant to their institutions.

Suggestions.Description: Sages arc defined by their extensive studies, and their characteristics reflect this life of study. Devoted to scholarly pursuits, a sage values knowledge highly – sometimes in its own right, sometimes as a means toward other ideals.

Personality.1: I use polysyllabic words that convey the impression of great erudition.
Personality.2: I've read every book in the world's greatest libraries – or I like to boast that I have.
Personality.3: I'm used to helping out those who aren't as smart as I am, and I patiently explain anything and everything to others.
Personality.4: There's nothing I like more than a good mystery.
Personality.5: I'm willing to listen to every side of an argument before I make my own judgment.
Personality.6: I… speak… slowly… when talking… to idiots,… which… almost… everyone… is… compared… to me.
Personality.7: I am horribly, horribly awkward in social situations.
Personality.8: I'm convinced that people are always trying to steal my secrets.

1.Title: Knowledge
1.Value: The path to power and self-improvement is through knowledge. (Neutral)

2.Title: Beauty
2.Value: What is beautiful points us beyond itself toward what is true. (Good)

3.Title: Logic
3.Value: Emotions must not cloud our logical thinking. (Lawful)

4.Title: No Limits
4.Value: Nothing should fetter the infinite possibility inherent in all existence. (Chaotic)

5.Title: Power
5.Value: Knowledge is the path to power and domination. (Evil)

6.Title: Self-Improvement
6.Value: The goal of a life of study is the betterment of oneself. (Any)

Bonds.1: It is my duty to protect my students.
Bonds.2: I have an ancient text that holds terrible secrets that must not fall into the wrong hands.
Bonds.3: I work to preserve a library, university, scriptorium, or monastery.
Bonds.4: My life's work is a series of tomes related to a specific field of lore.
Bonds.5: I've been searching my whole life for the answer to a certain question.
Bonds.6: I sold my soul for knowledge. I hope to do great deeds and win it back.

Flaws.1: I am easily distracted by the promise of information.
Flaws.2: Most people scream and run when they see a demon. I stop and take notes on its anatomy.
Flaws.3: Unlocking an ancient mystery is worth the price of a civilization.
Flaws.4: I overlook obvious solutions in favor of complicated ones.
Flaws.5: I speak without really thinking through my words, invariably insulting others.
Flaws.6: I can't keep a secret to save my life, or anyone else's.

1.Value: You are (or were) employed in Dalaran, whether an agent of the mage-court itself, a graduate, a mage-guard, or one of the factions that rule the city. The magical city of Dalaran is ruled by a council of mages, and is usually influenced by the interests of several factions. By the time of the Third War, there were many powerful wizards‘ guilds, who trained apprentices and served as a curious mix of faction, guild, and students‘ activities clubs. By the time of the War of the Lich King, the Sunreavers and Silver Covenant factions dominated the political scene.

2.Value: You may replace one skill proficiency from your background with Deception, Investigation, or Persuasion. Instead of common clothes, your clothes might be violet (representing the kingdom itself), or be of a color associated with one of the guilds. Also, you gain one of the following equipment depending on your role in Dalaran: a graduate‘s staff (if you were a graduate) or a signet ring of a faction (if you were a faction member).

Description.1: You are a sailor, one who makes their way in the world as traders, merchants, naval personnel, or even as smugglers or pirates when times get lean. Sailors can be found near any major body of water or in ports.

Suggestions.Description: Sailors can be a rough lot, but the responsibilities of life on a ship make them generally reliable as well. Life aboard a ship shapes their outlook and forms their most important attachments.

Personality.1: My friends know they can rely on me, no matter what.
Personality.2: I work hard so that I can play hard when the work is done.
Personality.3: I enjoy sailing into new ports and making new friends over a flagon of ale.
Personality.4: I stretch the truth for the sake of a good story.
Personality.5: To me, a tavern brawl is a nice way to get to know a new city.
Personality.6: I never pass up a friendly wager.
Personality.7: My language is as foul as a harpy nest.
Personality.8: I like a job well done, especially if I can convince someone else to do it.

1.Title: Respect
1.Value: The thing that keeps a ship together is mutual respect between captain and crew. (Good)

2.Title: Fairness
2.Value: We all do the work, so we all share in the rewards. (Lawful)

3.Title: Freedom
3.Value: The sea is freedom - the freedom to go anywhere and do anything. (Chaotic)

4.Title: Mastery
4.Value: I'm a predator, and the other ships on the sea are my prey. (Evil)

5.Title: People
5.Value: I'm committed to my crewmates, not to ideals. (Neutral)

6.Title: Aspiration
6.Value: Someday I'll own my own ship and chart my own destiny. (Any)

Bonds.1: I'm loyal to my captain first, everything else second.
Bonds.2: The ship is most important – crewmates and captains come and go.
Bonds.3: I'll always remember my first ship.
Bonds.4: In a harbor town, I have a paramour whose eyes nearly stole me from the sea.
Bonds.5: I was cheated out of my fair share of the profits, and I want to get my due.
Bonds.6: Ruthless pirates murdered my captain and crewmates, plundered our ship, and left me to die. Vengeance will be mine.

Flaws.1: I follow orders, even if I think they're wrong.
Flaws.2: I'll say anything to avoid having to do extra work.
Flaws.3: Once someone questions my courage, I never back down no matter how dangerous the situation.
Flaws.4: Once I start drinking, it's hard for me to stop.
Flaws.5: I can't help but pocket loose coins and other trinkets I come across.
Flaws.6: My pride will probably lead to my destruction.

1.Value: You spent your youth under the sway of a dread pirate, a ruthless cutthroat who taught you how to survive in a world of sharks and savages. You've indulged in larceny on the high seas and sent more than one deserving soul to a briny grave. Fear and bloodshed are no strangers to you, and you've garnered a somewhat unsavory reputation in many a port town.

2.Value: If you decide that your sailing career involved piracy, you can choose the Bad Reputation feature below instead of the Ship's Passage feature.

1.Value: The job of a balloonist is a risky but profitable venture in the world of Azeroth, as it is gradually becoming the medium of choice for transport across terrestrial lands. As a balloonist, you may have faced high winds, aerial foes, or delivered your charges (or cargo) across active battlefields to their destinations.

2.Value: Instead of proficiency in vehicles (water), you may be proficient in vehicles (air).

1.Value: Marines (or mariners) are, depending on their faction, either footmen or grunts specialized in the support of naval and army operations on land and at sea.

2.Value: As a mariner, may have served aboard the various airships and gunships of the Alliance or the Horde, and are often working alongside sailors. The human nation of Kul‘tiras is specialized in naval warfare and as such has a high number of marines among its forces. Mariners tend to operate under standard five-year contracts when signing on with a new crew as evidenced by the crew of the Wavestrider. While human marines are almost always found among the crews of Alliance gunships, it seems the orcish equivalent for them is "reaver", for reavers can be found among almost all orc gunships. Instead of a lucky charm, you may choose to receive an insignia of rank instead.

Description.1: You are a combatant who participated in a war or trained as such. With war being the fact of life in Azeroth, there is no end in sight for work, whether it be for a militia, professional standing army, or as a mercenary.

Suggestions.Description: The horrors of war combined with the rigid discipline of military service leave their mark on all soldiers, shaping their ideals, creating strong bonds, and often leaving them scarred and vulnerable to fear, shame, and hatred.

Personality.2: I'm haunted by memories of war. I can't get the images of violence out of my mind.
Personality.3: I've lost too many friends, and I'm slow to make new ones.
Personality.4: I'm full of inspiring and cautionary tales from my military experience relevant to almost every combat situation.
Personality.5: I can stare down a hell hound without flinching.
Personality.6: I enjoy being strong and like breaking things.
Personality.7: I have a crude sense of humor.
Personality.8: I face problems head-on. A simple, direct solution is the best path to success.

1.Title: Greater Good
1.Value: Our lot is to lay down our lives in defense of others. (Good)

2.Title: Responsibility
2.Value: I do what I must and obey just authority. (Lawful)

3.Title: Independance
3.Value: When people follow orders blindly, they embrace a kind of tyranny. (Chaotic)

4.Title: Might
4.Value: In life as in war, the stronger force wins. (Evil)

5.Title: Live and let live
5.Value: Ideals aren't worth killing over or going to war for. (Neutral)

6.Title: Nation
6.Value: My city, nation, or people are all that matter. (Any)

Bonds.1: I would still lay down my life for the people I served with.
Bonds.2: Someone saved my life on the battlefield. To this day, I will never leave a friend behind.
Bonds.4: I'll never forget the crushing defeat my company suffered or the enemies who dealt it.
Bonds.5: Those who fight beside me are those worth dying for.
Bonds.6: I fight for those who cannot fight for themselves.

Flaws.1: The monstrous enemy we faced in battle still leaves me quivering with fear.
Flaws.2: I have little respect for anyone who is not a proven warrior.
Flaws.3: I made a terrible mistake in battle that cost many lives – and I would do anything to keep that mistake secret.
Flaws.4: My hatred of my enemies is blind and unreasoning.
Flaws.5: I obey the law, even if the law causes misery.
Flaws.6: I'd rather eat my armor than admit when I'm wrong.

1.Value: You are trained in a town militia, practicing weaponry common to your race and ready at a moment‘s notice to answer the call to arms.

You are trained to guard and protect mages or other spellcasters. You could have been trained in the Violet City of Dalaran, have been cloistered with the priests of Northshire Abbey, or have been a childhood friend or sibling to a mage.

2.Value: Rather than training in Athletics and Intimidation, you may exchange one of the proficiencies with Arcana or Investigation.

1.Value: A crusade was the only answer to humanity in the fallen domains of Lordaeron and Dalaran. The undead armies of the Scourge were a tide that could not be pushed back save by the sword and the prayer.

2.Value: You might have once been a member of the disbanded Order of the Silver Hand, a farmer who threw down his farming tools and took up a rusted militia sword, or a youth who chose to leave the safety of the southern lands to fight back against the encroaching darkness under the mantle of the Light. Not every crusader is from the Paladin class, as they also boast Hunters and Priests among their rank, as well as the necessary Rogue.

3.Value: You may replace one skill proficiency from your background with Insight or Religion.

Farstrider.Title: Farstrider (High Elf and Blood Elf usually)

1.Value: You are part of the High Elven Order ofFarstriders, a paramilitary organization that is a similar reflection to the night elven Sentinels. After the destruction of Quel‘Thalas, the Farstriders began diminishing in importance, especially after the blood elves‘ newfound obsession with fel magic.

2.Value: Rangers form the scout and advanced skirmishing forces of Quel‘Thalas, while seekers are specialized assassins who infiltrate enemy lands and perform dangerous missions.

3.Value: You may replace one skill proficiency from your background with Nature, Insight, orPerception. Also, instead of proficiency with vehicles (land), you may gain proficiency with an herbalism or disguise kit. You may also gain the wanderer background feature of the Outlander instead of the Military Rank feature of the soldier background.

1.Value: You are part of the Night Elven Order of Sentinels, a religious/military organization that protects and preemptively destroys threats to the night elves and their lands.

2.Value: You may replace one skill proficiency from your background with Religion, Investigation, or Stealth.

Alchemist.Name: Alchemist

Introduction.1: A forsaken stalks the ruins of a murloc village, picking eyes and bits of flesh. As a skulking murloc prepares to jump out at her, she casually tosses a potion at its chest without glancing at it, causing the skin to bubble and blacken with a terrible—the last thing it sees are the forsaken‘s fingers reaching forward to take out its light.
Introduction.2: A gnome reaches down to his box of Alchemist‘s Supplies, picking a rare herb and some pinches of sea salt, before tossing them into a small battle-beaker warmed by a portable burner. With uncanny calm, he weighs the curative mixture, before delivering it to a dying friend, revivifying her.
Introduction.3: Laughing maniacally as he consumes his potion, the troll rushes into the fight, fingertips mutating into razor-sharp claws. As his muscles grow larger, and as his skin hardens, his eyes gleam with the promise of pain.
Introduction.4: A goblin mercenary sits on the back of a drugged ogre, tossing explosive potions. Wincing as a human warrior stabs his giant homunculus, he pulls out a potion from his side pouch and jams it down the ogre‘s throat. The crunch of teeth against glass invigorates the ogre, and, with a burp, it tosses its arm forward with great strength, tossing the human away as the alchemist laughs in triumph.

Alchemist.Description: Whether by careful measuring, self-experimentation, explosive mixtures, or supportive potions, an alchemist utilizes their own mix of magic and science, alchemical science, to support and heal wounds, decimate enemies, manifest unusual effects, or augment themselves to wade into battle. These lightly armored individuals are experts in creating a variety of special effects, from temporary explosives to elixirs that revive the dead.

Content.1: In the Warcraft universe, alchemy is not merely pseudo-chemistry - it is an art that draws power from the primal elements of life, not unlike actual magic. An alchemist is a master of the art who takes it leaps and bounds further than their peers, who are limited in their alchemical products to mere healing poultices and anti-toxins, reaching heights of reviving the dead or manifesting massive explosives.
Content.2: The greatest strength of an alchemist is their versatility. They can themselves adequately but can specialize in being battle-chemists who augment themselves with potions before tearing their enemies apart with their own hands. They can choose to focus on the augmentative powers of their mixtures, delaying harm and healing wounds, or to debilitate their enemies with negative status effects. Damage dealt by an alchemist‘s potions usually focus on concussive or poison damage, but they are also broad in scope, dealing fire or frost or lighting as required of them. The better they anticipate their opposition, the better the alchemist can prepare.
Content.3: The success of alchemists relies greatly on the formulae and recipes they have in their formula books. They gain new formulae as they gain experience, study other formula books, or research independently.

Content.1: Alchemists‘ lives may appear mundane, starting as a sage, independent researcher under a mage tower, a plague researcher, or member of a military force‘s supply chain. Other alchemists focus on trade, opening alchemy shops and selling anything from curative mixtures to love potions. Others still have adapted their talents to violence, such as serving in mercenary forces or the military, sapping structural defenses and focusing on combat support.
Content.2: The weight of knowledge and the demand for versatile potions calls for even the most sedentary alchemists to venture out to investigate strange happenings, support their friends, or answer the call to heroism.
Content.3: Alchemists are students, researchers, and scientists of the mysterious science of alchemy. To choose to alchemist class is to be more than a dabbler in the art of alchemy—they are utilizers of strange techniques that would empower themselves and their allies, experienced craftspeople who can make potions for fractions of the normal time and cost, and some have even modified their bodies to make full use of their skills.
Content.4: Creating poisons, potions, special explosives, and empowering substances, alchemists are either curiosities, prized members of society, or reclusive, feared experts in unstable weird sciences. Alchemy itself does not fall strictly in one end between science and magic, but is a potent force nonetheless.
Content.5: Alchemists support soldiers and adventurers, and could easily take to the field themselves, brewing and concocting potions, poisons, and poultices to support (or create) allies on the field. Some work to support their communities, others attempt to replicate (or surpass) the work of the Scourge's necromancers, and others focus on self-empowering through strange concoctions they imbibe.

Content.1: As you make your alchemist character, consider the origins of their knowledge: were they selftaught, a student of another alchemist, or did they gain this mastery by esoteric means? Alchemy is a difficult discipline—how did you accomplish the challenge to gain your status? Were you motivated by war, fortune, or by something else entirely, such as the lack of magical talent to become a spellcaster?
Content.2: Perhaps you preferred the reliable mundane science of alchemy over the unexpected extraordinary power of magic, or took comfort in the fact that you were in demand in an urban setting—there is no lack of adventurers who might need your aid as an alchemist if you do not wish to go out and adventure. Do you have any peers among alchemists? Do they perceive your approach to science as calm and intellectual, or rash but with great breakthroughs or a dangerous form of meddling with life and death that should not be tolerated? Do you have a special ambition or goal to achieve as an alchemist—such as making magic-like effects accessible to the mundane public, providing affordable healing, and counters to common ailments, or are your creations for your own monetary benefit?

Alchemist.QuickBuild: You can make an alchemist quickly by following these suggestions. First, Intelligence should be your highest ability score. Make Agility your next-highest if you want to use ranged or finesse weapons, or focus on throwing potions and explosives. Use Strength instead if you wish to empower yourself in battle and engage in combat via the mutate spell. Second, choose the guild artisan or scholar backgrounds. Third, choose the noxious fumes (poison spray), minor alchemy, and fire bolt cantrips, along with the following 1st-level spells for your formula book: burning hands, explosion, mutate, and rejuvenation.

Apothecary.Title: Apothecary
Apothecary.Description: You recognize no boundary of morality or faith in your pursuit of weird science. Reaching beyond the realms of experimention to dissect the supernatural, you employ necromancy, soul magic, and unusual diseases and poisons. Apothecaries usually dress as plague doctors or experimenters, dealing with death and strange occult things for reasons only they know.

Mutant.Title: Mutant
Mutant.Description: You push your body past the normal limit—mutation is no mere rage or chemical reaction; it is a secret science only you know. Mutants are often ostracized by society, which sees such unstable people to be dangerous and fickle in their moods.

Transmutor.Title: Transmutor
Transmutor.Description: Whereas the apothecary dabbles with the line between life and death, and the mutant experiments on themselves, you handle alchemy as a science and a tool, and are considered a more ‘classical‘ alchemist. Transmutors are appreciated in societies, often serving in courts or in magical circles to quantify the true nature of alchemy, sicknesses, and magic. In adventuring parties, they often focus on support.

DeathKnight.Name: Death Knight

Introduction.1: Clad in armor streaked with warm blood, the human‘s eyes glow in a cold blue light as he swings his greatsword with precise fury, keep foes occupied with him. As he does so, his allies around him watch as his wounds seem to heal by vampiric-like magic even as the enemy falls.
Introduction.2: Standing tall against the oncoming horde, a blood elf embraces the frozen resolve within to shrug off her enemies‘ attacks. Imbuing her twin shortswords with the power of the frozen north, her attacks break through their armor with reckless abandon, sending icy bits of armor, bone, and flesh flying.
Introduction.3: A dwarf gazes over the battlefield alone, remembering a past life when he commanded legions of his brethren to defend their homelands. No longer the same dwarf, he raises his hand, binding the corpses to undeath, once more in the position of command, old loyalties broken in death.

DeathKnight.Description:
Years after the destruction of Draenor, the immensely powerful Lich King created a new breed of death knights: malevolent, rune-wielding warriors of the Scourge. The first and greatest of these was the Lich King's chosen champion, Prince Arthas Menethil. Once a mighty paladin of the Silver Hand, the prince sacrificed his soul to claim the runeblade Frostmourne in a desperate bid to save his people, and having his soul bound for eternal servitude under the Lich King. The rest are primarily made up of other fallen paladins whose souls were twisted and bound to the will of the Frozen Throne.
Like Gul'dan's death knights, these dark champions possess unholy strength; they, however, do not possess free will and their minds are inexorably entwined with and dominated by the Lich King's vast consciousness. Despite the potential loss of free will, some powerful mortals are intrigued by the promise of immortality and pledge their souls freely into the Lich King's service to achieve it. In the years since Arthas shattered the Frozen Throne and merged with the Lich King, the power and fury of the death knights has only grown. Now these unrelenting crusaders of the damned eagerly await the Lich King's command to unleash their fury on Azeroth once again. Unlike death knights of the Old Horde, the Scourge's death knights are not limited to their use of ranged spell casting abilities. In addition, these tireless death knights are considerably stronger, faster, and more agile than they were in life. However, both generations are equally destructive and terrifying to engage in the field of battle.

Content.1: Most death knights were once virtuous defenders of humanity and truth as paladins. However, once the paladin ranks were disbanded by the failing Alliance, many of these holy warriors traveled to the quarantined lands to ease the suffering of those left within the plague-ridden colonies. Though the paladins were resistant to disease, they were persecuted by the general populace who believed that they had been infected by the foul plague. A small band of paladins, embittered by society's cruelty, traveled north to find the plague's source. These renegade knights succumbed to bitter hatred over the course of their grueling quest.
Content.2: When they finally reached Ner'zhul's icy fortress in Northrend they had become dark and brooding. The Lich King offered them untold power in exchange for their services and loyalty. The weary, vengeful warriors accepted his dark pact, and although they retained their humanity, their twisted souls were bound to his evil will for all time. Bestowed with black, vampiric Runeblades and shadowy steeds, death knights serve as the Scourge's mightiest generals.

Content.1: When the Lich King's control of his death knights was broken, his former champions sought revenge for the horrors committed under his command. After their vengeance was won, the death knights found themselves without a cause and without a home. One by one they trickled into the land of the living in search of a new purpose.
Content.2: The Knights of the Ebon Blade is a faction consisting of the renegade death knights that broke free of the Lich King's control after the battle of Light's Hope Chapel. Led by Highlord Darion Mograine, the Knights of the Ebon Blade have allied themselves with the Alliance and the Horde with the help of Highlord Tirion Fordring of the Knights of the Silver Hand, and have pledged to do their part in defeating their former master, the Lich King. Their main base is Acherus: The Ebon Hold, taken from the Scourge after breaking free.

Content.1: When creating your Death Knight, consider your relationship with the person or being that resurrected you. Do you know who it was, or why they brought you back from death? Do you feel indebted to them for giving you a second chance at life, or are you angry that they took you away from your eternal rest?
Content.2: Death knights often have terrible stories to tell that ended with their deaths. Consider your story before your death—if you were once a paladin, consider the oath you took. Do you remember it? Do you choose to follow those tenets again, or forsake your paladin teachings and follow a new path? If you were a noble or important member of your society, how do you cope with their expectations and your role? What evils have you committed under the Lich King‘s dominion? Have you committed crimes that you secretly approve of, such as the murder of a noble who let you down in  your old life, or lethally ending rivalries in life? Have you been commanded to use your power to raise the dead, and have you had a choice in raising anyone you once knew?
Content.3: Also, consider if and how you will attempt to reintegrate with society; most citizens of Azeroth fear and suspect the intentions of death knights, and might try to sabotage their acceptance. Have you wronged anyone who might oppose your reentry into society? Will you accept being separate from all factions, and choose to take up quests with only like-minded individuals?

DeathKnight.QuickBuild: You can make a death knight quickly by following these suggestions. First, Strength should be your highest ability score, followed by Charisma. Second, choose the noble or criminal background.

Corruption.Label: Corruption
Corruption.Description: Upon gaining a level in this class, you may permanently pledge your soul as well, turning yourself into an undead creature (permanently gaining the below Undead Nature ability, and counting as the undead creature type).

RuneSpells.Label: Rune Spells
RuneSpells.Description: Death Knights are the only class that can access the rune array spell, and can prepare different runes for strike effects. Runes are magical enhancements that can enhance a death knight‘s weapon attacks, and can be released in coordination with the Runic Strike ability to cause a devastating strike.

RuneBound.Label: Rune Bound
RuneBound.Description:
Upon gaining a level in this class, you can turn one (of both, if using two weapons to fight) of your weapons into Runeblades, a weapon infused with the might of the Lich King and his blessing. Runeblades have three benefits:
  • They serve as spellbooks and store spells (as described under Spellcasting).
  • You gain advantage to saving throws against any effect that controls your character or alters their alignment against the Lich King‘s will while using them.
  • The blade serves as an unholy symbol.
  • The runeblade is a greater attunement weapon (see Chapter 5: Equipment).

You cannot have multiple Runeblades (beyond the one you choose or two you fight with). If lost, the blade usually finds its way back to you (or you to it) due to the bond you share.

PathOfBlood.Title: Path of Blood
PathOfBlood.Description: You are a dark guardian who manipulates and corrupts life energy to sustain themselves in the face of the enemy‘s onslaught. Blood death knights invoke ancient legends of blood-drinking beings who are immortal on the battlefield.

PathOfFrost.Title: Path of Frost
PathOfFrost.Description: You are a harbinger of doom, channeling runic power and delivering freezing weapon strikes. Frost death knights are terrors of the frozen wastes.

UnholyPath.Title: Unholy Path
UnholyPath.Description: You are a pale horseman of death, leading undead troops to battle, fueled with hatred of the living. Unholy death knights lead armies of the dead and overwhelm their enemies.

Druid.Name: Druid

Introduction.1: The night elf notices a broken blade of familiar design, and then a disturbance in the distance. She rises, and runs toward the sound, leaping through the forest expertly and silently. As she comes to a waterfall, she leaps off the edge of the cliff, a wave of purple mist enveloping her, as she shapeshifts into a saber cat, prepared for further pursuit.
Introduction.2: An ancient troll stands quietly atop an equally old ziggurat, eyes narrowing against the bright red sunrise. In the distance, the waves bring the promise of war as ships sail towards his homeland. He speaks a prayer to the Loa, before shapeshifting into a leathery-winged primordial pterrordax, and rising upon the winds to scout the danger approaching his home.
Introduction.3: A worgen stalks the forest, hunting her quarry, smelling blood. She emerges to a worgen stirred into a blood-frenzy upon a wounded human, prepared to bite it. She shouts, causing the mindless beast to turn to her. She raises her hand, bringing a pillar of moonlight down, searing the worgen‘s fur. As the blinding light subsides, an unconscious human lies on the grass, curse overwhelmed by the moon-goddess‘s holy strength.

Druid.Description: Druids are keepers of the world who walk the path of nature, following the wisdom of the Ancients and Cenarius, healing and nurturing the world. To druids, nature is a delicate balance of actions in which even the smallest imbalance can create storming turmoil from peaceful skies. Druids draw their power from this natural energy, using it to change their shapes and command the forces of nature. Traditionally, druids chose the path of a specific animal totem. Since the invasion of the Burning Legion, however, most druids have undergone a number of reforms, including encouraging the study of magic from all totems. Druids who do this are known as druids of the wild.

Content.1: Druids harness the vast powers of nature to preserve balance and protect life. With experience, druids can unleash nature‘s raw energy against their enemies, raining celestial fury on them from a great distance, binding them with enchanted vines, or ensnaring them in unrelenting cyclones. Druids can also direct this power to heal wounds and restore life to fallen allies. They are deeply in tune with the animal spirits of Azeroth. As master shapeshifters, druids can take on the forms of a variety of beasts, morphing into a bear, cat, storm crow, or sea lion with ease. This flexibility allows them to fill different roles during their adventures, tearing enemies to shreds one minute and surveying the battlefield from the sky the next. These keepers of the natural order are among the most versatile heroes in Azeroth, and they must be prepared to adjust to new challenges on a moment‘s notice.
Content.2: Cenarius is the patron entity of all druids. However, each group of druids has its own special patrons and some even have the ability to transform into a being that looks like their patron. Many druids take on an animal companion based on their patron.

Content.1: A druid's empathy with the creatures of the wild also allows him to shapeshift into the forms of other animals. For example, a wounded druid whose magical energies are running low might  abruptly take on the form of a bear in order to better withstand further injury. Alternatively, the druid might shift into the form of some large cat, sneak up behind an enemy, then pounce and deliver a fierce flurry of melee attacks. Even the deepest oceans can be explored by a druid, who can simply shift into an aquatic creature, allowing him to stay underwater as long as needed. Druids come and go as they please, and their goals typically have little to do with the ‗civilized‘ world. Unaffiliated with any specific government, the primary druidic organization on Azeroth, the Cenarion Circle, answers to no one but itself.
Content.2: The highest rank that a druid can have is that of archdruid, and there are only a few archdruids on Azeroth. At the moment the Cenarion Circle's leader is Archdruid Malfurion Stormrage, also widely considered to be the first (and greatest) mortal druid on Azeroth.

Content.1: When making a druid, consider why your character has such a close bond with nature. Perhaps your character lives in a society where druidism still thrives, or was raised by a druid after being abandoned in the depths of a forest, or burdened by a terrible curse to which druidism was a cure. Perhaps your character had a dramatic encounter with the spirits of nature, coming face to face with a giant eagle or dire wolf and surviving the experience. Maybe your character was born during an epic storm or a volcanic eruption, which was interpreted as a sign that becoming a druid was part of your character's destiny.
Content.2: Have you always been an adventurer as part of your druidic calling, or did you first spend time as a caretaker of a sacred grove or spring? Perhaps your homeland was befouled by evil, and you took up an adventuring life in hopes of finding a new home or purpose.
Content.3: Druids harness the vast powers of nature to preserve balance and protect life. With experience, druids can unleash nature‘s raw energy against their enemies, raining celestial fury on them from a great distance, binding them with enchanted vines, or ensnaring them in unrelenting cyclones.
Content.4: The druids of Azeroth nearly all belong to the circle of Cenarius. Druids otherwise corrupted still belong to the same circle. Azerothian druids are more limited in the shapes they may choose when transforming, but they gain an additional ability to empower said form.

Druid.QuickBuild: You can make a druid quickly by following these suggestions. First, Spirit should be your highest ability score, followed by Stamina. Second, choose the hermit background. Third, choose the gust, thorn whip, and wrath cantrips, along with the following 1st-level spells for your idol: primal roar (abandonment aura), charm (beast), conjure (beast), entangling roots, faerie fire, and rejuvenation.

CircleOfBalance.Title: Circle of Balance
CircleOfBalance.Description: You achieve a balance between the powers and influence of the moon and sun. Balance druids usually stand in the back lines, invigorating their allies and calling down shooting stars on their foes.

CircleOfFeralBeast.Title: Circle of Feral Beast
CircleOfFeralBeast.Description: Your magical talents bring you closer to beasts of the wild, making you prime and paragon above them. Feral druids often take up traits of the beasts they shape to.

CircleOfRestoration.Title: Circle of Restoration
CircleOfRestoration.Description: You focus on the renewing and resilient quality of nature. Restoration druids appreciate the more organic side of nature, preferring to conjure plant allies (usually treants), heal their friends, and reach out through the Emerald Dream for information and insights to the future.

Shaman.Name: Shaman

Introduction.1: A tauren standing atop a cliff calmly raises his hand, leaning on a giant halberd, sprinkling reagents upon the grasslands below. The golden dust is carried on a spirit of the wind. A giant totem bound to his back trembles in approval.
Introduction.2: A red-bearded dwarf stands on shaking ground, unmoved, as the earth cracks before him, spewing the beginnings of lava. As his comrades collapse, he points at it with commanding presence, shouting in a primordial tongue that speaks to the very earth. The beginnings of a chaotic volcanic eruption slow, before the primal powers of the earth and fire retreat, calmed, back into the earth.
Introduction.3: Cleaving through fiendish foes with a bloodied axe in one hand and lightning-enhanced attack claws in the other, the orc shouts a war cry to rally his allies.
